text: I came across some code which kind of puzzled me.
Here's a minimal example which shows this:

code:
# of course, the ... are not part of the actual code
some_var = {"key1":"value1" ... "keyN":"valueN"}

def some_func():
   v = some_var["key1"]

text: The code works, but the fact that I can access some_var directly confuses me.
The last time I had to write some Python code, I remember having to write some_func like this:

code:
def some_func():
   global some_var
   v = some_var["key1"]

text: I am using Python 2.7.1 on a Windows 7 PC.
Did something change in the 2.7 release that allows for this?
